intro: Cicca virens, commonly known as the green cicca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant green leaves and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Cicca virens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
